intro: Galedupa velutina, commonly known as the velvet galedupa, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
